member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies the sort order for files appearing in the form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.DateAscending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by date, in ascending order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.DateDescending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by date, in decending order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.NameAscending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by name, in ascending order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.NameDescending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by name, in decending order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.SizeAscending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by size, in ascending order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SortOrder.SizeDescending
member.summary: Picture files are sorted by size, in decending order.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog
member.summary: Defines attributes and behaviors of a custom dialog box for selecting pictures.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the "Select Picture" dialog box.
member.remarks: This is a modal dialog box.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SelectPictureDialog class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the selected picture file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the file types displayed in the Select Picture dialog box.
member.value: A description of each filtering option, followed by the vertical Bar (|), followed by the filter pattern. Multiple filtering options are also separated by the vertical bar. For example, "Bitmap Files|*.BMP|JPG Files|*.JPG"

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.FilterIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the currently selected filtering option.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.InitialDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory displayed in the Select Picture dialog box.
member.remarks: If null, a default directory is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.LockDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can browse to directories other than the InitialDirectory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.ShowDrmContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Digital Rights Management (DRM) protected files are displayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.ShowForwardLockedContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Digital Rights Management (DRM) protected files that are protected such that they cannot be forwarded, are displayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the Select Picture dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which files are sorted in the Select Picture dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.CameraAccess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is given access to the camera, from the Select Picture dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets this control’s owner control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog
member.summary: Defines the attributes and behaviors of a custom dialog box for choosing Contacts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the Contact Chooser dialog box.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ChooseContactDialog class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the Contact Chooser dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ChoosePropertyText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text label of the Property Chooser control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.RestrictContacts
member.summary: Gets or sets the restriction string used to generate a filtered Contact list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.IncrementalFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the incremental filter box.
member.remarks: The Incremental Filter box appears at the top of the Contact Chooser dialog box. The list of contacts in the dialog will be restricted to those matching this text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.HideNew
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can create a new Contact.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ChooseContactOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is limited to choosing just a Contact, or choosing a property of a specified Contact.
member.remarks: If true, the returned property is the first non-blank property in RequiredProperties. ChoosePropertyOnly and ChooseContactOnly cannot both be set to true. In the event that both are set to true, setting ChooseContactOnly to true will automatically set ChoosePropertyOnly to false

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ChoosePropertyOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is limited to choosing just a property of a specified Contact, or choosing the Contact.
member.remarks: If true, SelectedContact must be set before calling ShowDialog. ChoosePropertyOnly and ChooseContactOnly cannot both be set to true. In the event that both are set to true, setting ChoosePropertyOnly to true will automatically set ChooseContactOnly to false

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.RequiredProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the ContactProperty array values that specify which properties a Contact must have in order to be shown in the Contact Chooser dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.SelectedContactName
member.summary: Gets the selected Contact’s name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.SelectedPropertyValue
member.summary: Gets the selected property value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.SelectedContact
member.summary: Gets or sets the Contact.
member.remarks: If ChoosePropertyOnly is true, then SelectedContact sets the Contact from which the user selects a property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.SelectedProperty
member.summary: Gets the selected property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode
member.summary: The capture mode of CameraCaptureDialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.Still
member.summary: Dialog takes a still picture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.VideoOnly
member.summary: Dialog takes a video without audio.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.VideoWithAudio
member.summary: Dialog takes a video with audio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality
member.summary: The still quality of CameraCaptureDialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Default
member.summary: Default quality, user last selected in options dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Low
member.summary: Low quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Normal
member.summary: Normal quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.High
member.summary: High quality.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes
member.summary: The video types of CameraCaptureDialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.All
member.summary: When used, only consider resolution when matching video profiles. If either width or height of resolution is 0, the one user last selected will be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.Standard
member.summary: Used for generic purpose with high quality video output, such as produced by WMV encoder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.Messaging
member.summary: Used for messaging service, such as MMS that need 3GPP conformance encoder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog
member.summary: CameraCaptureDialog class that wrap SHCameraCapture to launch camera capture dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of CameraCaptureDialog class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.AllocUnmanagedBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates unmanaged buffer of the specified number of bytes.
member.returns: Unmanaged buffer allocated with specified length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.ToUnmanagedString(System.String)
member.summary: Allocates unmanaged buffer for the specified managed string.
member.returns: Unmanaged buffer allocated for the specified managed string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.LaunchCameraCaptureDialog(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Call SHCameraCapture to launch camera capture dialog.
member.param: Struct parameter for unmanaged camera capture API.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the "Camera Capture" dialog box.
member.exception: Thrown when operation ran out of memory.
Thrown when an invalid argument was specified.
Thrown when an unknown error occurred.
member.remarks: This is a modal dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the control that owns this component.
member.value: A control object that owns this component.
member.remarks: This property value can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.FileName
member.summary: Gets the full path filename of the picture or video captured.
member.value: The full path filename of the picture or video captured.
member.remarks: If dialog returns DialogResult.OK, this is set to the full path filename of the picture or video captured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.InitialDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory to store new picture or video.
member.value: The directory to store new picture or video.
member.remarks:
If null, we store the picture the directory defined in the Pictures application options.
If the directory doesn't exist, System.ArgumentException will be thrown out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.DefaultFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename to store new picture or video.
member.value: The filename to store new picture or video.
member.remarks:
If null, we use the file name defined in the picture application options.
If the file already exists, we will overwrite it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets dialog title.
member.remarks:
If null, a default title is displayed. The default title is "Camera".
On Smartphone, the first time the user enters the Camera View, the title bar displays the text specified with the CameraCaptureDialog.Title property (by default: "Camera").
On Pocket PC, the title bar should be the name of the calling application. However, the settings header text displays the text specified with the CameraCaptureDialog.Title property (by default: "Camera").

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.StillQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the still quality.
member.remarks:
The default is the quality the user selected last in the options dialog.
If the value is not defined in CameraCaptureStillQuality enumeration, System.ArgumentException will be thrown out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.VideoTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the video types.
member.remarks:
The default is All type.
If the value is not defined in CameraCaptureVideoTypes enumeration, System.ArgumentException will be thrown out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the image to be taken.
member.value: The resolution of the image to be taken.
member.remarks:
The default is (0, 0).
For video mode, if either Width or Height is 0, only VideoTypes will be considered when selecting video profile.
For still mode, this value is reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.VideoTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets time limit when taking video.
member.value: The time limit when taking video.
member.remarks: 0 means no limit. Default is no limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets capture mode.
member.remarks:
The default is still picture capture.
If the value is not defined in CameraCaptureMode enumeration, System.ArgumentException will be thrown out.
